Package com.xebisco.yield

Class PhysicsBody

java.lang.Object
com.xebisco.yield.YldB
com.xebisco.yield.Component
com.xebisco.yield.YldScript
com.xebisco.yield.PhysicsBody
public class PhysicsBody extends YldScript
It's a class that allows you to add physics to your entities

  • Field Summary

    • destroyFixtures

      public void destroyFixtures()
      > Destroy all the fixtures attached to the body

    • resetColliders

      public void resetColliders()
      Destroy all the fixtures on the body, then create new ones based on the colliders attached to the entity. The first thing we do is get a list of all the colliders attached to the entity. Then we destroy all the fixtures on the body. Finally, we loop through the colliders and create new fixtures based on them

    • update

      public void update(float delta)
      Description copied from class: Component
      Called on every frame of the scene.
      Overrides:
      update in class Component
      Parameters:
      delta - The time variation between the last frame and the actual one in seconds.

    • updateEntity

      public void updateEntity()
      It updates the entity's position and rotation based on the Box2D body's position and rotation

      Description copied from class: Component
      Called when the Entity of this component is destroyed.
      Overrides:
      onDestroy in class Component

    • goTo

      public void goTo(Vector2 location)
      If the body exists, set the position of the body to the location divided by the pixels per meter ratio. Otherwise, set the position of the self transform to the location
      Parameters:
      location - The location to go to.

    • position

      public Vector2 position()
      Return the position of the body.
      Returns:
      The position of the body in the world.

    • translate

      public void translate(Vector2 location)
      If the body exists, translates the body's position by the location, otherwise translates the transform's position by the location.
      Parameters:
      location - The location to translate.

    • applyImpulse

      public void applyImpulse(Vector2 value, ImpulseType impulseType)
      Apply a force or impulse to the body. The first parameter is the force or impulse to apply. The second parameter is an enum that tells the function whether to apply a force or an impulse.
      Parameters:
      value - The value of the impulse to apply.
      impulseType - This is an enum that can be either FORCE or LINEAR.

    • isAllowSleep

      public boolean isAllowSleep()
      Returns true if the body is allowed to sleep
      Returns:
      The boolean value of allowSleep.

    • setAllowSleep

      public void setAllowSleep(boolean allowSleep)
      Sets whether this body is allowed to sleep
      Parameters:
      allowSleep - If true, bodies are allowed to sleep. Sleeping bodies have very low CPU cost.

    • getAngularVelocity

      public float getAngularVelocity()
      Returns the angular velocity of the body
      Returns:
      The angular velocity of the object.

    • setPhysicsSystem

      public void setPhysicsSystem(PhysicsSystem physicsSystem)
      This function sets the physics system to the physics system passed in.
      Parameters:
      physicsSystem - The PhysicsSystem that will be used to update the physics of the entity.

      Parameters:
      angularVelocity - The angular velocity of the body in radians per second.

    • setFixedRotation

      Parameters:
      fixedRotation - If true, the body will not rotate.

    • isContinuousCollision

    • setContinuousCollision

      public void setContinuousCollision(boolean continuousCollision)
      > Sets whether continuous collision detection is enabled
      Parameters:
      continuousCollision - If true, the object will be checked for collisions continuously. If false, the object will only be checked for collisions when it moves.
